metadata.Title: CVE-2017-12141 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
In ytnef 1.9.2, a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability was found in the function TNEFFillMapi in ytnef.c, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12141` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libytnef0 - 1.5-6ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libytnef package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5-6ubuntu0.2').
